channel.title: Alert
channel.description:
How do I make an alert box or that pop-up blocker bar appear when someone's IP address is not is my MySQL table, i.e. they are not regstered on my forums.
Thanks
Jellybean732

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:4, topic:182892”][quote author=super_ link=topic=244272.msg2070078#msg2070078 date=1203649720]

this is javascript.
seems everyone that has posted before me are idiots.
[/quote]lawl, wrong.
it seemed that his post contained psuedocode.

Or, lawl assumed he was talking about a web language since he referenced to MySQL and forums. Don’t go telling people they are ‘wrong’ unless you yourself knows what this guy is talking about.

once again, everyone is fucking retarded here
its obviously javascript, no other well known language has alert()

alert() was most likely a pseudo-function, lawl, so again you can be wrong.

i am always right, regardless, faggot[/quote]

oh how could i forget

Read full topic

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I believe he’s referring to PHP AND JavaScript. Seeing as you’d need PHP to check a mysql database, which would in turn do

echo("alert('Register on my forums!')");

It would appear you need to learn some real programming, as nobody is going to do this for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Do a TOS page like mopar has but redirect them to the register screen and customize the error to say they must register before logging in.

Otherwise, if you are using an SMF forum you can use a feature in the Administration panel to disallow guests from viewing the forum. This does exactly what I said above ^.

Read full topic

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @Jellybean732 Jellybean732
item.description:
@Jellybean732 wrote:

Basically a code that sends them an alert when they load any page of my website if they are not registered on my forums (found by checking IP address against my MySQL database).

Read full topic

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Hmm… He could mean like a pop up window in Java. Or if he wants Java;
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog() I guess.
For more information I guess here] would be sufficient.

Read full topic

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

When do you want this alert to pop up though? When they try to log in with a private server client? Or in the actual browser? You need at least a general idea of what you want before anyone can help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Alert
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:7, topic:182617”][quote author=speedster239 link=topic=244272.msg2062615#msg2062615 date=1203371084]

Well I’m not sure what the best programming language for this function is. soz

It looks like you need to ask in the web development section, this seems like a php question.
[/quote]

not really, you could write it with servlets and jdbc.[/quote]

And you could write it in php, ruby, perl, etc. Let’s just sum it up and decide that he is expecting someone to write him a piece of code by which he has no idea how it works.

Read full topic
